item.title: By: Xavier B. (@somenxavier)
item.dc:creator: Xavier B. (@somenxavier)
item.description: Why don't you remove all the information and just ask "How long is the building?". You could provide some information like: angle, distance to the building, distance to the top, vertical angle, etc. and that the students choose the information that we think to need and put into the draw. All the information you offer them is equivalent. For example, if angle is 72ยบ, then vertical angle is 18ยบ. But they have the freedom to choose what information they need although they solve the same problem
